name: Imperial Restructuring
description: While it is an undeniable fact that the German Empire is the greatest nation to ever grace the pages of history, there is always room for improvement. In light of recent 'shortcomings' in our administration we should look into making various policy changes and reforms for a better future.

name: The Easter Promises
description: On April 7th 1917, when the war was at its very worst, after the horrifying 'Turnip Winter', the Kaiser promised substantial reforms and the abolition of the three-class voting system in Prussia. However, he promised all of that without offering an actual date. It might be time to remind the Kaiser of his promises...

name: Organise the Youth
description: Some experts have suggested that the best solution against the current lawlessness in our nation's youth would be organising them so that they can learn new skills and employ their energy for the public good. The Pfadfinder organisation would require increased spending for such an endeavour.

name: Institute the Verdeckte Reichspolizei
description: The Syndicalist terror is nearly as bad as back in 1928, when Reichsbank President Karl von Helfferich was shot by a lone gunman. Back then, a countrywide crackdown brought some measure of peace, but now security forces seem powerless. There have been proposals to found a new police force, the Verdeckte Reichspolizei. The 'Verpo' would work in the shadows, to save us all from the darkness of radicalism.

name: Embrace the FAUD
description: The Freie Arbeiterunion Deutschlands has been a troublesome organisation. By embracing them and finally allowing them to operate unhindered, we could maybe make sure that they don't radicalise further.

name: A Christian Trade Union
description: By founding the Deutscher Christlicher Gewerkschaftsbund as a state-endorsed union, we will hopefully establish a bulwark against attacks on the workers' loyalty from left and right. Workers will be able to voice their concerns under the moral authority of priests and the guiding hand of the 'summus episcopus': the Kaiser.

name: Ban French Organisations
description: The formerly French-controlled regions in western Germany have been unruly for a long time. French nationalism is widespread, and French cultural and political organisations have strong roots in the region even now. Banning them could suppress French nationalism, or it could serve to inflame tensions and radicalise the population. The Commune of France will not be happy either way.

name: Democracy in Prussia
description: The current voting system in Prussia is archaic and undemocratic. The people are split into three strata according to their income, with the lowest strata, representing over sixty percent of the population, receiving as many delegates as the upper one, which represents less than ten percent! We should finally implement universal, secret and equal franchise for all citizens of Germany.

name: Expand Babelsberg
description: The Babelsberg film studios have long replaced Hollywood as the most influential film industry of the world. However, on movies as far removed from politics as possible, is anything but supportive of the state. Some producers, namely Leni Riefenstahl, have proposed some projects that, with our funding, could help remind the Germans of their glorious past and future.

name: Women's Suffrage
description: While the Prussians now finally have their universal, secret and equal franchise, the women of Germany are still exempt from the vote. Awareness of this issue has been steadily rising, and clubs modelled on the British suffragettes are recruiting new members. If we want to avoid the public embarrassment that the British suffered in that affair, we should maybe consider fulfilling their requests.

name: Restore the Bundesrat
description: Under the Ludendorff regime, many of the privileges of the constituent countries of Germany were abolished. The largest of these insults was the formal dissolution of the Bundesrat, the chamber where delegates from all countries can voice their concerns and vote on empire-wide legislature. By reinstating this organisation, we would send a powerful and positive signal to the states of Germany.

name: Finalise Centralisation
description: The independent postal services of the kingdoms of Baden, Württemberg and Bavaria in southern Germany are some of the last remnants of the old federal structure of Germany. By finally expanding the responsibilities of the national German postal service to these states, we could help suppress these damaging particularist tendencies. Germany is not something you can opt out of!

name: Schleicher's Kamarilla
description: The Kaiser made von Schleicher Reichskanzler due to his promises to secure Germany against threats both from the democrats as well as the Junkers. However, now that he has his office, Schleicher has been restaffing important offices and making contracts with Junker companies, and some people whisper about a sinister plan to get the Junker into power after all...

name: Final Reforms
description: For too long people have battled over where power should lie in our great government. It is time to answer that question once and for all.

name: Aftermath of Black Monday
description: The great stock market crash of 1936, widely known as 'Black Monday', has already had a massive impact on German politics, culture, and society. While the damage might never be truly known, let alone fixed, we should enact reforms and recovery policies to regain some of our lost capacity.

name: Liquidate Unprofitable Estates
description: The statesman Wilhelm Groener has recently published an essay titled 'The black zero: the need for austerity', in which he demands absolute balance discipline, even if it means losing some companies depending on subsidies. The essay has found a lot of adherents within the populace, and liquidating a few unprofitable companies may be just what we need to alleviate our expenditures.

name: Reichsarbeitsdienst
description: The contacts and friends of Groener in military circles have now proposed a radical innovation. For the duration of the crisis, recruits will be able to choose to fulfil half a year of military service as manual labourers in state service instead. While bad for recruitment numbers, this will inject some much needed labour into our economy.

name: Gehaltskürzung
description: Cutting the enormous salaries of those "Officials" who can more then afford to do so, hasn't been met with open arms. Many have called Groener a Syndicalist in sheep clothing, but quickly retracted their statements on threat of release of their "Expenses" during the crisis. Though it would appear the Groener won't be invited to any social gatherings amongst the aristocracy for quite some time.

name: Bail Out Junker Estates
description: The president of the Reichsbank, Hjalmar Schacht, has demanded a green light to go ahead with his economic programme, dubbed the 'Schachtplan'. According to him, we need to bail out the highly indebted Junker estates if we don't want to trigger an even further descent into chaos.

name: Investitionsprogramm
description: The next part of the Schachtplan would be a massive programme aiming to encourage private investment, both into Mittelstand businesses as well as consumer products. While this will be hard to achieve, it should enable producers to find a market for their products again, which will hopefully help to restart the economy.

name: Goldstandard
description: Dropping the gold standard within the Empire will allow for productivity to grow due to further reliance on the Mark. Though many have argued against this, stating the effects of Black Monday are more short term then long term, Schacht's reply is that short term effects are crippling the Empire and allowing for its competition to get ahead.

name: The Kanzler and the Radio
description: The crisis has shaken the German's belief in their country. Public faith is key, so starting weekly radio addresses to announce what steps the government has taken to combat the crisis will help avoid panic and keep trust in our administration.

name: Finish Black Monday Reforms
description: It seemed impossible, but the numbers confirm it - the crisis is nearing its end. The key point is that it is not yet over. There are still millions without jobs, and civil society has been stretched to breaking point. The catastrophe of Black Monday will leave marks for a generation, but this is the beginning of the end.

name: Reform Mitteleuropa
description: For too long Mitteleuropa has existed in name only. It is time for is to start reforming it to actually benefit its members... and us. The first step is unified tariffs.

name: State of the Economy
description: It's good, really. The industry is humming along, the grain is coming in from the eastern member states of the Reichspakt, many citizens have work. It's looking up for the Kaiserreich, and it seems like nothing will be able to stop the golden age of the late Reichskanzler Tirpitz...

name: Experimental Research
description: While we have already made good progress in some of the more traditional fields relevant to industry - engineering, chemistry, physics - some of our scientists want funding to conduct research into some more esoteric matters. Though profit might not be as immediate, the long-term potential is immense!

name: Embrace Synthetic Rubber
description: With increasing demand of rubber skyrocketing prices, we should remind the world that the first synthetic rubber was created in the Bayer laboratories in Elberfield, and as such we can employ the minds of our chemists to further refine the methods of creating it, to augment our sources of natural rubber.

name: Research in Synthetics
description: In cooperation with members of the Kaiser Wilhelm society, IG Farben researchers have already been able to make astounding breakthroughs on the area of synthetic production. By giving them access to more funds, we might be able to make their research ready for mass implementation.

name: Extra Research Funding
description: Investing in science and technology to stimulate advances in both military and civilian affairs. Isn't that an awfully good phrase? It doesn't really say anything, but it sure sounds good. Anyway, the laboratories are over there...

name: Support Konrad Zuse
description: Konrad Zuse has already handed in several patents for what he calls a 'computing devices'. With proper sponsorship, his mind could be put to good use by the state, for the state.

name: Support Hahn & Meitner
description: Herr Hahn and Fräulein Meitner are both extremely talented physicists; Hahn is regularly published in science journals even in the Syndicalist bloc, and Meitner is a department head at the Kaiser Wilhelm Institute! Together, we believe, the two can help create extremely powerful tools for society. And even more powerful weapons.

name: Support von Braun
description: Von Braun is a notorious proponent for the field of 'Rocketry' and is the most accredited scientist for the field worldwide. He comes to us with the offer of new weaponised designs in return for sponsorship. We should heavily consider this.

name: Subsidies for Siemens
description: Siemens is one of the many middle-to-larger sized businesses that form the heart of the German economy. By making contracts with them - and some other smaller industry companies - we can begin treading the slow and steady path to economic recovery.

name: Deutsche Bahn
description: Germany is a large, busy nation, and the most practical solution for transporting goods and supplies is definitely locomotives. Funding a quick project to touch up our rail-system and extend it to some more rural parts of the country will stimulate the economy and help connect the nation a bit more.

name: Reichsautobahn
description: Trains are now, but cars are the future. Reichskanzler Tirpitz ordered the construction of several highways throughout Germany, but the projects remain uncompleted--Worse, progress has all but stalled in the wake of Black Monday. We need to not only complete this project, but think even bigger...

name: Krupp Steel
description: All this talk about infrastructure and helping our citizens is nice, yes, but what about artillery? Tanks? Planes? The world isn't safe, and Friedrich Krupp AG has the solutions we need! They've served Germany for generations, and the time has come to call on them again.

name: ZIP I
description: Our heavy industry is in shambles, with many workers out of a job after their former employers were forced to submit to the crisis. Some of our leading economic researchers have proposed a plan for civil industrialisation, the Zivilindustrialisierungsplan, to revitalise the civilian industrial sector.

name: ZIP II
description: The first phase of the Zivilindustrialisierungsplan has shown promise, but there is more yet to come. At least some of the worst social and economic disaster has been alleviated, though.

name: ZIP III
description: With our civilian industry once again strong, but not yet booming, we are required to take just a few more steps. Soon enough German industry will tower above the rest of the world once more, as the steady influx of resources from the colonies assures a massive production boost.

name: Economic Boom
description: With our economic policies following the Black Monday widely regarded as a resounding success, private investors have picked up on the lead, and the economy has not only stabilised but is currently experiencing a boom of sorts. It won't hold forever, but for the minute at least we can concentrate on other pressing issues.

name: Siemens Favouritism
description: With our shift recovery owned much to the efforts of Siemens, the government has seen to it that they are further "favoured" in regarding any new construction contracts.

name: Artillery Research
description: An area in which the German army has a longstanding tradition of lagging behind is the area of light support artillery. While the successes in building huge, unwieldy and impractical prestige objects such as the 'Paris Gun' can't be doubted, it's time to invest in some of the more practical - and more efficient - alternatives.

name: PEkI I
description: Black Monday has hit the civilian industry horribly, and the military industry has been affected even worse. Our military supply specialists are clamouring for a programme for the extension of war-relevant industries, or Programm für die Erweiterung kriegswichtiger Industrien, to ensure our military has bullets to fight.

name: PEkI II
description: The Programm für die Erweiterung kriegswichtiger Industrien - or abbreviated PEkI, but who would want to abbreviate such a good, German word - is making progress. At least our arsenals don't have to open their last reserves whenever a unit wants to move out anymore. There's still some way to go, but at least we are on the right path.

name: Military Industrial Complex
description: With unrest in the West and the bear awakening in the East, Germany for then ever needs to be ready for the challenges that are ahead of it. With investing in our local arms producers, we will ensure the German soldier is well equipped for the challenges that lay ahead

name: Mauser Contracts
description: Founded under the auspices of the mighty Friedrich himself, Mauser has been instrumental in aiding the growth of German power over the past century. By sponsoring them more directly we can increase and improve our small arms production.

name: New Weapons
description: While the German army has the greatest soldiers in the world, it must not lag behind in equipment terms. Even the greatest of soldiers will have a hard time defeating a better equipped enemy and it would not do for the pre-eminent world power to have troops armed with broomsticks.

name: Invest in Panzer Factories
description: With a little directed investment we could raise the productivity of our armour factories quite substantially. Some of our more conservative-minded generals are unlikely to approve of this investment however.

name: Military Expansion
description: The Chief of General Staff has been embroiled in heated debate as to which military doctrine should be adopted. We should establish an impartial committee of military officers to oversee the adoption of new doctrine.

name: Reactivate the Ludendorfflinie
description: The Syndicalist menace looms darker than ever. In fear of going into the next war unprepared, the reactivation of the old Ludendorfflinie on our western border is considered vital. Once one of the dictator's many costly prestige projects, the line of bunkers and fortifications has fallen into disuse in recent years. This is nothing that cannot be solved with a bit of engineering ingenuity!

name: Fortify Bastenach Alone
description: Our resources are stretched thin and time is of the essence. Even though Flanders-Wallonia may lie somewhat undefended compared to the Franco-German border, we cannot afford to waste time defending foreign territory that will be lost sooner or later anyway.

name: Over the Meuse and Far Away
description: Our puppet regime in Brüssel is screaming for help against the Syndicalists. Extending the reactivation of the Ludendorfflinie over the Meuse river and up to the North Sea coast would be costly and take up precious time - but it might enable us to make a stand on foreign soil so that not one German civilian is threatened.

name: Fortify the Rhineland
description: The Rhineland is the most heavily industrialised region in the entire world and absolutely vital to our economy, both in peace and in war. All the same, it lies only a few miles away from a border that many have been eyeing nervously in recent months. In order to prepare against any eventualities, we should start extending the Ludendorflinie northwards.

name: The Modern Art of War
description: There is one book that every man who wants to become an officer in the army of the Reich must read - Clausewitz's 'The Art of War'. If we put our best military theorists on the subject, they can adapt the still applicable principles from the centuries-old book to the requirements of modern warfare.

name: A New Doctrine
description: Some of the more radical innovators in our high command including, among others, Heinz von Guderian and Erich von Manstein, are lobbying for research into a totally new doctrine. They want to focus on the fast movement of armoured spearheads to break up solid fronts.

name: Squad Tactics
description: The Chinese Intervention and more recent conflicts have convinced our officers of the importance of coordination within individual squads. We should integrate so called 'Gruppentaktiken' into our infantry training regime.

name: Motorised Infiltration
description: While our military high command is divided on many subjects, they are united on one topic: that the possibilities mass motorisation offers to our infantry can be exploited to win decisive and speedy victories on an operational scale, hearkening back to the victory of 1870/71.

name: Armoured Breakthrough
description: Another crucial point of Guderian and Manstein's new doctrine is the so-called Schwerpunkt. They believe that Panzer technology has advanced to a point where massed, mobile Panzer forces, with adequately equipped support troops, should be able to lead any offensive to victory. Now they need new Panzers to fit this idea.

name: Militarist Revival
description: The German people are renowned for their bellicosity and national pride. The Weltkrieg, however, cost us dearly and many a family was denuded of its menfolk. It is time for us to revive the militaristic spirit of the Prussian era, in the name of the Reich and the Kaiser!

name: New Textbooks
description: Since 1810 the famous Prussian War College has been inarguably the most prestigious military institute for higher learning in the world. However, prestigious does not necessarily mean up to date. Our military doctrine has thoroughly changed in the last few years, and while some classics never get old - Clausewitz still saves stressed students - others have fallen out of date. It is time to replace them.

name: Manoeuvres in Elsaß-Lothringen
description: The despicable Communards feel bold enough to defy our rule and are supporting insurgents in Lorraine! After extensive talks with the Kaiser and High Command, the Chancellor has approved partial mobilisation of the reserves and is considering a massive military exercise in Alsace-Lorraine involving air and armour detachments and military observers from the Reichspakt member states.

name: Keep the Fliegertruppe
description: Our aviators are currently organised as part of our army structure, without an independent air force command. This boosts cooperation between aviators and ground troops, and therefore leads to the current doctrine concentrating solely on that; air support with ground force primacy. This specialisation is suitable and should remain our policy.

name: Sturzflieger
description: One concept that has recently found a lot of supporters among aviation researchers is that of an aircraft that dives from great heights onto the battlefield to deliver its payload, using its momentum to climb again immediately afterwards. This concept, dubbed Sturzflieger, would minimise the time our precious aircraft would be in immediate danger.

name: Coordinated Close Air Support
description: The requirements and possible uses of close air support aircraft have proven to be far different from those of more mainstream fighter aircraft. If we concentrate our air research capabilities on identifying and exploiting the intricacies of this specialised form of air warfare, we should be able to achieve far better results in aircraft manufacturing.

name: Build More Airbases
description: Build airbases both in the Heimat and outer provinces so that we can set the infrastructure for better defence and offence in the skies.

name: Institut für Luftfahrttechnik
description: An independent research organisation for aviation technology, the Institut für Luftfahrttechnik, could prove a major stepping stone on the way to ensuring German dominance not only on the ground and on the sea, but also in the skies.

name: An Independent Luftwaffe
description: Since the Weltkrieg the Red Baron, Manfred Freiherr von Richthofen, has argued for the establishment of an independent air force - the Luftwaffe, as he likes to call it. Up until very recently, the conservative elements in the traditionally more prestigious ground forces have been able to prohibit this, but with war looming once again, it might be time to consider the Baron's idea.

name: Bombergruppen Doctrine
description: One of the first results of the founding of Richthofen's Luftwaffe has been the invention of a new doctrine. This doctrine asserts that the possibilities of massed bomber warfare are exciting enough to warrant primacy over the traditional ground support. Fighters should not be used on the ground, where they can be subjected to anti-air attacks, but in the skies where they can escort bomber squadrons.

name: Naval Aviation Corps
description: Another result of the untangling of air warfare from ground warfare has been the founding of a group of aviators focused on naval aviation. These pilots, trained in special courses, are now demanding aircraft to fit their special requirements.

name: Long-Range Fighters
description: As a result of the Bombergruppen doctrine, the demands on range of operations has multiplied. Theorists and researchers are demanding new aircraft models to keep up with their increasingly aggressive bombardment plans. After the Paris bomber comes the London bomber, after that the Moscow bomber - and there doesn't seem to be an end!

name: Expand Singapur Airstrips
description: Singapur is the centrepoint of German East Asia. A fortress city, it has great demands for both civilian as well as military airstrips. We should meet this pressing need by investing in construction to protect our naval station from foreign rivals in the region.

name: Paderborner Luftkriegsschule
description: The establishment of a formalised school for our aviators would help immensely in unifying and promoting this currently somewhat disorganised field. There are a lot of heroes of air warfare from the Weltkrieg, the most famous of course being the Red Baron himself, whose insight can still be valuable to new recruits. There, they could impart their wisdom to a new generation of German pilots.

name: Cult of Aviation
description: The image of the aviator has changed in the current conflict. They have replaced the cavalry as the image of the glorious and gallant war. Every child aspires to be an aviator and streak across the skies in his shining armour. By further fostering this image, we can motivate our pilots to give their very best in the service of the Reich.

name: Found the Luftlandetruppe
description: Due to our continuing focus on ground-air cooperation, there have been proposals of greatly expanding our Paratrooper division, which is currently in its infancy. This might have to do something with the fact that jumping from a flying plane does not seem very glorious or entertaining - or survivable, really. We should promote the image of the paratrooper as the spearhead of the Kaiser's military.

name: Finish 1934 Navy Plan
description: The Kaiserliche Marine stands unchallenged on any sea, for now. The Union of Britain, the French Commune, the Americans and the Japanese all jealously seek to catch up with us and if left unchecked, our naval domination will end as quickly as it began. We should continue the large navy modernisation project initiated back in 1934 to keep our fleet one step ahead of our rivals.

name: Supply Lines to Singapur
description: Having an empire across the globe has the small disadvantage of having to actually exert control over those areas, and that means sending not only soldiers, but also tax collectors and other vermin. Our officials need tax forms and invoice documents, bureaucratic elements that need to be sent all the way from Germany. We must ensure that our supply chain is adequately supported to reflect this reality.

name: Expand Singapur Harbour
description: Now that we have the capacity to exert our control more effectively over the supply lines to Ostasien, we need an adequate endpoint to the chain. The harbour of Singapur is the busiest in the eastern hemisphere, with German ships on their way to the Chinese concessions, Australasians Delhi-bound and the occasional American or Russian. Commerce is good; we should expand the harbour.

name: Expand Wilhelmshaven
description: We require an expanded port for basing for both our submarines and our larger fleets. Investing into the crucial Kaiserliche Marine base at Wilhelmshaven is a good start for accomplishing this.

name: Flanders-Wallonia Naval Bases
description: We require more ports in the North Sea to ensure we have a chokehold over our enemies' trade and to discourage a repeat of the Weltkrieg blockade. Expanding our naval bases within Flanders-Wallonia such as in Antwerpen will help this goal.

name: Treaty with Ireland
description: Assailed from all sides, the Irish have turned to the Reich for protection. We should offer them a full treaty so that we'll have a loyal ally in the fight against the Union of Britain.

name: Fortify the North Sea Coast
description: The North Sea Coast must be defended. In the unlikely event that our entire fleet is lost then our flanks would be dangerously exposed, and so we must begin fortifying the coastline at once.

name: Fortify our Naval Bases
description: In line with the coastline fortifications we should seek to better defend our vital naval bases from amphibious invasion.

name: Modernise Our Cruisers
description: Cruisers, both light and heavy, make up the backbone of our naval forces. We must modernise our cruisers at once in order to stay competitive.

name: New Destroyer Fleet
description: Destroyers cannot escape the gaze of our new modernisation programme. We will draft and construct a new modern destroyer fleet.

name: Renew Tirpitzprogramm
description: By 1914, the Tirpitzprogramm had given Germany the second-largest naval force in the world. That was a long time ago, and the British fleet is no longer the biggest in the world. All the same we must not be idle. Germany must continue its extensive ship building efforts if we are to remain master of the high seas.

name: Deutschland beherrscht die Meere
description: Deutschland beherrscht die Meere ("Germany Rules the Waves") are the words our navy lives and dies by. We shall launch a new series of training exercises on the North Sea coast to give our sailors some more experience at sea.

name: Heed Dönitz's Words
description: The highly respected and talented Karl Dönitz reminds us that the success of ocean-going navies is dependent on them actively controlling the seas. Our fleets should strive for large, decisive battles and destroy our opposition before they get a chance to intercept our supply routes. This doctrine has been dubbed Präsenzflotte.

name: U-Boat Warfare
description: We conducted U-Boat warfare throughout the Weltkrieg but we restricted our attacks in order to avoid courting international condemnation. This policy shall continue but with a new range of U-Boat models at our disposal.

name: Larger, Faster, Heavier
description: Larger, faster, heavier. These are the words that our navy should live by when designing new warships. We shall make it so.

name: Listen to Patzig and Raeder
description: Patzig and Raeder have, in close communication with Sperrle of the Luftwaffe, devised a type of naval strategy reliant on mobile airbases in the form of carrier ships. These men are convinced that on the open sea, where assistance can take days to arrive, ships should only be risked if they fight together as one group with air cover under a doctrine known as Operative Manövergruppen.

name: Naval Air Force Research
description: The Luftwaffe have demanded extra funding if they are to implement the new Manövergruppen naval doctrine. We should grant this funding with the expectation of solid results.

name: Extend Carrier Research
description: Manövergruppen requires new carriers. We shall construct these stalwart new additions to our Grand Fleet at once.

name: Independent Seebatallions
description: We must retrain and expand our marine corps to meet new challenges against enemies overseas. Granting them increased autonomy within naval command should give us better results.

name: Marine Transports
description: We lack dedicated landing craft for our Seebattalions. This must change if we are to storm the British coastline and take our fight to nations on distant seas. We shall design and construct a new dedicated amphibious landing craft to meet this challenge.

name: Europarat
description: There have been recent proposals swirling around for a new body to increase integration of Mitteleuropa. Europarat, or the 'Council of Europe' would act as an effective monitor of cross-European trade and relieve the administrative burden of it on all Mitteleuropa.

name: Europakommission
description: With the resounding success of the initial Mitteleuropa reforms we shall expand and extend it to include further industrial measures under a single Europakommission. This body would focus on harmonising industrial regulations across Mitteleuropa and unifying the economies of all members over time.

name: Secure Gibraltar
description: The Rock is the key gateway into the Mediterranean from the Atlantic, we shall demand the Spanish hand this over to us so we can better protect our southern holdings.

name: Pacify Spain
description: Why should we let Spain decide their own fate? They are either with us or against us and if they have chosen the latter then they deserve everything we deliver unto them.

name: European Exchange Programme
description: The Europarat has provided sufficient returns to expand its overall control to include matters of our research programs too.

name: Grain and Steel
description: Grain and steel are the lifeblood of our great nation and we should make sure it stays as such. We must invest in industrial development and our agriculture.

name: Paktbrigaden
description: In an effort to create a unified command structure under German control, the formation of Paktbrigaden have been decided with manpower drawn from Germany and all Reichspakt members.

name: Develop Border Regions
description: The border regions of our empire currently lack infrastructure and investment, we shall rectify both with one swift move.

name: Expand the Ostwall
description: Our eastern allies are vulnerable to any aggression coming from the Russian Bear. We must expand the Ostwall defences to give our partners a fighting chance before our forces arrive.

name: Destroy the Internationale
description: The greatest threat to stability in the world is by far the Syndicalists, and they have no greater stronghold than the Internationale. For years, High Command has dreamed of leading troops into Paris again, restoring order in Europe and eradicating the vile Red Menace forever. There is no better time than now to strike. Let the communards tremble, for the Reichspakt comes!

name: Subjugate Russia
description: While we dealt the Russian Bear a crippling blow in the Weltkrieg, years of covert and open rearmament have made the Russian nation eager for war and revenge against the German Empire. As long as the Russian threat exists on the eastern border, Germany and her allies are not safe. We cannot continue to let the menace of the East continue to build up its strength gradually; it is time to curb Russia's ambition and bring peace and order to the East once and for all.

name: Deepen Polish Ties
description: Our initial forays into improving diplomatic ties with Poland have met with some amount of success. It seems that Poland too wishes to settle our past disputes and break the political stalemate of the past two decades. A proper diplomatic mission to Poland should warm our mutual relations and set the foundation for Poland to eventually move into our own sphere of influence.

name: Bring Back Order
description: Poland has been a diplomatic oddity in Europe for far too long. Stuck in political limbo between the German and Austrian power blocs since the end of the Weltkrieg, it is time for proper German order to be brought back to the Polish state. Either through strong diplomatic effort or by force of arms, Poland will be brought into the German sphere where it belongs.

name: The Oil Must Flow
description: Our colonial empire is the body and oil is the blood that fuels it. We must secure and maintain our supplies if we are to avoid disaster.

name: From the Caucasus
description: The Caucasus is a region rich with oil and filled with small regimes, many of which that are within our sphere of influence. We should being to levy this influence in the pursuit of oil.

name: Through the Ukraine
description: One route to ensuring that we have uninterrupted oil supplies is by securing access across the great steppe from the Don-Kuban Union of the proud Cossacks. It may not be Azerbaijan, but securing its oil supplies is a good first step and will allow us to channel Azeri oil when the time comes.

name: Military Mission to the Cossacks
description: If we are to keep the Russians in check we must ensure we can combat them on all fronts. Let us send aid to our allies in the Don-Kuban union and help them build their army.

name: Secure Georgia
description: As part of our operation to eventually seize control of the Baku oil fields in Azerbaijan it is essential that we seize control of Georgia by launching an invasion across the Black Sea. As a diplomatic oddity in the region, its end will not be mourned.

name: The Baku Conference
description: The time has come for us to acquire our main prize, the oil of Azerbaijan. If we arrange a meeting with senior Azeri diplomats in Baku, we may be able to come to terms with them. By guaranteeing their independence they might just be willing to come under our suzerainty without a fight.

name: Settling Old Disputes
description: There is a time for hurting and a time for healing. With the debt question with the Ottomans settled, the time for healing has arrived. We should let bygones be bygones and work towards a closer friendship with our Turkish allies.

name: Research Cooperation
description: Ottoman scientific expertise is severely lacking as for one the literacy rate of the Sublime Porte is abominable. Furthermore, the Sublime Porte was never really able to catch up the west in terms of military development and has since mostly relied on imported goods. Through our newfound connections to the Ottoman Empire, we can help them both access better equipment and educate their own people for the future.

name: Vanguard in the South
description: Just like Belgium in the West and Lithuania in the East, the Sublime Porte forms Germany's Southern frontier and are as such tasked with an important role in guaranteeing our possessions in the region. From geographical features such as the Suez to the Caucasus to strategic ones such as the Oil fields of Iraq and the Chromite mines of Anatolia, the Ottoman Empire is an invaluable cog in the great machine of the Kaiser.

name: From Venezuela
description: Venezuela is a land rich with untapped oil and blessed with a relatively stable government, both factors that make them of great interest to us.

name: Send a Procurement Expedition
description: Now that we have identified Venezuela as a viable partner we will send a procurement expedition at once to make the necessary contacts required.
